info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 22 at 11:36AM EDT until March 23 at 12:45AM EDT by NWS Caribou ME
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues.
* WHERE...A portion of Northern Maine, including the following county, Aroostook.
* WHEN...Until 1245 AM EDT Sunday.
* IMPACTS...Water over the North Caribou Road at the Caribou and Fort Fairfield town line, and flooding of low lying areas along the Aroostook river.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1132 AM EDT, local law enforcement reported the ice jam remains locked in place. Minor flooding is ongoing. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Caribou and Fort Fairfield. - For flood safety visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Water levels can rise and fall quickly in the vicinity of ice jams. Those with interests along rivers and tributary streams should be alert for rapidly fluctuating water levels in the vicinity of ice jams. Never drive through flooded roads or around closed road barricades. The barricades are there for your safety due to the potential for ice jam releases or continued flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY FOR AN ICE JAM NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM EDT SUNDAY
